utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: My offer's withdrawn; you can walk to work.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Got it, you're morally outraged. Now can we get through this part? 'Cause the next part's awesome.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: How do you rationalize something like this? You broke into Stacy's therapist's office--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Borrowed a key

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: --and stole her treatment notes!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope! I made copies. Mark is, and I quote "Withdrawn, passive-aggressive, won't communicate, like he resents me because I can walk."

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I don't want to hear this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Dishes in the sink, toilet seat up. Meanwhile, she can't stop thinking about I can't read that, is she obsessed with a Grey Horse? Or me?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It says she thinks you're an annoying jerk.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's a pet name. Here's the kicker.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: They're not having sex?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Doctor cleared him, but no liftoff. She's frustrated so she's doc-blocking me. Paperwork, seminars, meddling with my patients

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Great, now you've got the proof you need. Just take those personal psych records to Cuddy, that'll show her Stacy's out of control. You ignoring me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: While looking for my newspaper, efficient huh?

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Over here!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Dr Wilson, I want you to meet my stalker

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Your waiting room sucks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I am not treating you.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: What, because you're a closet-case?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Err... we're not... err... together.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He is so self-loathing. Well, we've got to go now, so maybe see you after work--

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: No, no, no! Ah... nobody can figure out what's wrong with me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well your shirt is gaping at the collar, means you lost weight, you're flushed, that's fever, and you're short of breath. And finally there's the KS lesion on your face; means you're HIV positive, you've progressed to full-blown AIDS. So you're sick because your immune system is shot and someone sneezed on you. Can I be excused now?

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Brilliant, but, my immune system is fine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your concentration camp physique begs to differ. Get your T-cell count re-checked.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: I've already done that.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: They test for T-cell lymphoma?

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: It was negative.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: All of this will be fascinating to an HIV specialist. Now let go of my cane before it becomes your new boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Honey, I will marry it if you would look at my file.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Congress says you can't, so...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I didn't touch him.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He's going into anaphylactic shock.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Go see Stacy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We gave him epi, he's fine.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You need a lawyer, go see Stacy. You hit a patient.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Four words, two mistakes. He's not a patient, and I didn't hit him.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Of course you didn't, go see Stacy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I didn't cause the anaphylaxis. It's probably one of his HIV meds abacavir.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'll pass that along; make sure the ER takes him off it. Go see Stacy.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: You have to treat him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Medically, this case is a snooze-fest. AIDS plus infection.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: You don't treat him he charges you with assault.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just 'cause he says I hit him doesn't make it true. Watch, I am surrounded by naked cheerleaders See? Although I like my chances of some action this morning.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: I forgot Wednesday was hooker day. This could've waited!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You make me meet you at your house. Your husband is conveniently absent.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Mark's at physio, I'm stuck waiting for the exterminator. I saw a rat last night.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, I'm surprised your feet are touching the floor.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: I barely slept.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What was Mark up to? Memory serves, quick climb up Mt. Gregory, and you dozed through a seal hunt. Clubbing, shrieking.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: What're you doing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry, it's driving me nuts.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: You hate washing dishes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: People change. I could make sure youâ€™d sleep like a baby tonight.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Rather take care of that myself.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was referring to the rat.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Trenton Pests is sending a guy.

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not what you think. I know it looks like we're cleaning dishes, but actually we're having sex.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: We're working.

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: Wow, wish I'd become a doctor. Place would be spotless.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Take ten minutes, cure the guy, and stop whining.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I give you Kalvin Ryan; so flamboyant in person, so boring on paper. Obviously got an opportunistic infection, probably TB or PCP.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Have you read his file?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I started, but I found the characters two-dimensional.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He went to an HIV clinic last week. Tested negative for TB, PCP, MAC, CMV, HSV. It's not an infection.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: HIV clinic. So few patients, so much money; re-do the tests.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: The results make sense. Kalvin's T-cells are at 200.That's strong enough to fight infection.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fine, parasite.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Nope, stool sample was negative.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Two months ago, he was down to 30 T-cells, then he changed his meds, his immune system rebounds, his viral load drops, everything's getting better but he's getting sicker.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Face it; this might be an interesting case.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What if his immune system is too strong?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: An auto-immune disease? With HIV, that's impossible.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: His new HIV meds kicked his system out of a sound sleep. It wakes up hungry, cranky, spoiling for a fight. When it doesn't find an active infection, starts attacking the harmless remnants of old infections. Immune reconstitution syndrome.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: His meds made him so much better, he made himself sick. Sounds pretty--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: BORING! This is so not interesting. Chest X-ray and find the old infections, start him on steroids.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: If you're wrong, steroids will tank his immune system. He'll get worse.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Now THAT would be interesting. Where's the coumadin?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: If your patient's got a blood problem then blood thinners aren't exactly--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's for Stacy's rat; death by anti-coagulation.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Trying to win Stacy back by killing an animal... very caveman.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't want her back. I just want her to admit her feelings for me. I go to Cuddy, Cuddy fires her or re-assigns her. Either way, I'm happy.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: If you want her back, either tell her, or, better yet, shut up, and cry yourself to sleep like everybody else.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hi, this is Mark Warner, 1724 Spring Street. Listen, you don't need to send that guy down, we caught him. No, you should send the bill to Princeton-Plainsboro hospital. Attn: Dr James Wilson, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Your lymph nodes aren't swollen. Thatâ€™s good.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Maybe Dr Chase should check.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Sorry mate, hands full.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: He's too pretty to be straight. You ever done any modeling?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Does anyone actually fall for that line?

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Every day. Why do you think I became a photographer? I'm guessing you guys didn't think about dating on career day.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I love my job.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Really? You seem more the 'find it exceptionally satisfying' type.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I'm not sure there's a difference. Your mom died of diabetes. How's your dad's health?

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Last I heard he had cirrhosis. Love, is love, satisfying is â€˜social validation, fun can waitâ€™.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I have fun.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yeah, she's got some scheduled for February. Last you heard? Your father?

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: He threw me out when I was 16. It's just as well; I got tired of getting BB guns for my birthday when I'd asked for a Barbie.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Dads can be real sweethearts.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Mmm, sensitive, AND cute.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He's cute.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: It ran into that heating vent right there.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hopefully Mark's anger will go away eventually.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: He's not angry, just doesn't like you. Nothing unique there.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Didn't seem really wild about you, either.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: He's fine with me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's angry. Said so in group.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Of course he's angry; he's looking at months of painful physio.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's mad at you.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: There's no way he said that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, but it's true. He resents you for being able to walk. Been there. I resented you for hell of a long time.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Past tense?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Might be the hospital.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What!?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Bad time? Where are you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: At your girlfriend's place. Ignore the moaning and squeaking.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: His lungs are too scarred to tell which infection triggered the immune reconstitution.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He a smoker?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Yes, and possibly more than cigarettes. His tox screen came back positive for recreational drugs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not surprising. Not medically relevant.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: His heart looks a little enlarged.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's a typical side-effect of AZT. What are Kalvin's most recent infections?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Toxo, CMV and PCP.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well let's assume it's one of those. Give him Ganciclovir for the CMV...

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Whoa, we can hardly hear you. Where are you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: In a closet. Your girlfriend's other boyfriend showed up. Ganciclovir for the CMV, Sulfadiazine for the Toxo, Bactrim for PCP. Gotta go. It's killing time.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Your tox screen came back positive for--

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Crystal meth aaand ecstasy.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Recreational drugs are dangerous to begin with, but for someone with HIV...

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: I didn't mistake them for vitamins. I'm a PNP boy. Party and Play. Drugs and sex. You don't approve?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Does the sex include condoms?

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: If he's negative, sure. If he's positive, why put on a raincoat if you're already wet?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You could get hepatitis or another strain of HIV.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Or I could get hit by a bus.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: AIDS isn't a death sentence anymore.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: I don't want to have any regrets.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: How long have you been coughing?

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: About an hour or so.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Try to take a deep breath.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: I think its blood.

utterance.speaker: Doctor
utterance.content: I recommend post-exposure prophylaxis. Your chances of conversion are slim, but I'd like to put you on three antiviral medications; finavir, zidovudine and lamivudine. There are side-effects - headache, nausea, vivid dreaming. You'll be tested for HIV in 6 weeks, 3 months, 6 months...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Very interesting.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He coughs infected blood in Cameron's eyes and mouth, that's interesting?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The coughing part, not the in Cameron part. New symptom, blood vessel ruptured in his lung.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I closed the tear.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well it takes immune reconstitution off the table. What's it put on the table? Its ok, she's not here. You can skip the nice guy acts.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You know some human beings are actually capable of human feelings.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My giving a damn or not is not going to change what happened.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Could be Kaposi's Syndrome.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No edema, no blood in urine.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: KS on his face could mean KS in his lungs, with bleeding from the lesions.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I would have seen them when I repaired the tear in his lung. Wegener's granulomatosis?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Wegener's would have responded to the steroids.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Maybe you should go home, take the rest of the day.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I'm fine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh this is good, he's pretending to care, you're pretending not to.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I think we should reconsider drugs. Kalvin uses crystal meth.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Concerned enough about his health to stalk me while indulging in deadly street drugs. Study in contradictions. Interesting. Still not medically relevant.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It could be, if his drugs were tainted. They cook meth with battery acid, lye, lantern fuel...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Find Kalvin's pills, test for toxins Foreman, you're with me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I need a consult on another case.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You have another case?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's a hip-pocket deal. Patient presents with a distinct neck tilt.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Wry Neck. Is he an athlete?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's a regular runner.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Any pain associated with movement.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: None that he's complained of

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Best case scenario, an infection in the ear or lungs; worst case, brain stem tumor. Should do an MRI, CAT scan, full work-up.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Uhhâ€¦ I don't think so No insurance.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No drugs in here. I'll take the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How about a drink after work? Take your mind off what happened. Cameron?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I might have HIV, a drink's not going to wash it away.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: There's like zero chance of you contracting the virus.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Big difference between 'like zero' and 'zero'.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What did the infection control guy tell you?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He was very reassuring, kept reminding me that the hospital covers all my medical costs. Apparently forgot to mention that if I do test positive, that they'll pass it on to legal and legal will dig up any dirt they can trying to prove that I'm a drug user or tramp, and that's why I have HIV.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's not like they're going to find anything, right?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Check this out.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Kalvin's a photographer. The broken bulbs were props. Glass is from 1930's fluorescent.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Some of the bulbs have date stamps.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Pre-World War II fluorescent bulbs contained large amounts of beryllium. Beryllium dust inflames the lungs, they get rigid, patient can't breathe. My father co-authored a paper on acute berylliosis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Phew! For a moment there I thought you were smart. Cameron, get a biopsy of Calvin's lung tissue. Run a spectrographic analysis.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I can handle it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No reason to risk exposing the entire team. Then who would I torment?

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: I'm sorry. About what happened.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It's best not to talk. You're going to feel a sharp pinch. This actually is going to grab a piece of your lung.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: What were you guys looking for at my hotel?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Your drugs. Thought maybe you'd used toxic meth. We'll know if you're exposed to beryllium in a few hours.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Well if you're still curious, it's in my bag over there on the chair.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You brought drugs into the hospital?! Glad I wasted my time at your hotel.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: I told you I used; you didn't ask me for a sample. You're not pissed about this, you're mad because I coughed blood on you.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: That was an accident.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Oh, would you stop being nice! It's useless and worse, it's boring. Get angry! I had one stupid night, I end up with HIV, do you have any idea how pissed off I was?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: This wasn't your fault.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: You broke into my house?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well I had to, Mark isn't here.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: He has physio.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh really? How's he doing?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: What happened with all the cheese?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I had to get rid of it before Steve McQueen ate any coumadin. I named your rat. Steve's tilting his head. Any neurologist will tell you that suggests an infection or brain stem tumor.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Death cures both those things.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well we can't kill him. If it's an infection, it could be caused by something in your house, something that could affect you guys . Smell this, does it smell like urine?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You missing any asparagus? Ok, stuff these. He doesn't get better, then itâ€™s a tumor.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Then what? Chemo?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Steve McQueen without hair? It's a blessing he died young.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Hello. Oh, hi honey. I'm sorry I missed you, yeah, I came home. Alright, I'll see you in a few minutes, okay, bye hon.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Chest hurts!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Heart rateâ€™s a hundred and climbing, could be an allergic reaction.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Neck veins are out; must be pericardial effusion. No wheezing.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Tear in his lungs must have re-opened.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Kalvin, you're bleeding into the area around your heart.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: I'm dying? I can't breathe!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: The blood's crushing your heart, once we remove it, you'll be fine.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: If I die, please... tell my dad--

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You're not going to die.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: --tell... him... sorry.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Where's the blood? It's clear.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Only one other thing could cause this; a tumor in his heart.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: CT confirmed a mass in Kalvin's heart and several smaller ones in his lungs.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That's why his heart's enlarged, not the AZT.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You ok?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's fine, probably getting bored with the question. Masses in the heart and lungs, what kind of cancer are we looking at?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: They may not be cancerous.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: This is classic Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma; HIV positive patient with a primary heart mass.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It could be sarcoidosis.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: His lung tissue is negative.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Lymphoma's a death sentence, sarcoidosis is treatable.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So's an ear infection, but since he didn't test positive for that eitherâ€¦

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I wanna do the Kveim-Siltzbach test.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do you have any idea how much paperwork Cuddy is going to need signed? Do it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Soâ€¦ how is the patient's father?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Uhâ€¦

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: â€˜Tell my dad I'm sorry?â€™ Might as well wave the red flag at a bull.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He's not coming.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well it's not a tragedy, dad doesn't want to see him, he doesn't want to see the dad. You're the only one who wants them together.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He asked!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He thought he was dying. Dying people lie too. Wish they'd work less, they'd been nicer, they'd opened orphanages for kittens. If you really want to do something, you do it; you don't save it for sound bite.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: What did you say when you thought you were dying?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: On the other hand, his dad tossed him out. So what's our guy want to apologize for?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Everybody has regrets.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: If the growths in your lungs and heart are sarcoid, your body will recognize this material and we'll see a reaction on your arm. Did you really want to see your dad?

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Did you call him? Thanks. He would have come, try to straighten me out. How are you holding up?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I'm fine.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Convincing. What did you do with my drugs?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: The lab disposes of them after analysis.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Too bad. They could have done you some good.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Not really my thing.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: You know I hope you don't have it, but getting HIV might have been the best thing that ever happened to me. I used to be a good boy. Never wanted to piss anybody offâ€¦ playing by the rules makes everybody else happy. Now I'm happy.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So you just show up every time he's at physio?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 'Course not! Also when he's at group therapy, or out for dinner with friends.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And when she happens to mention to Mark that you dropped by?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You tell your wife everything?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's aâ€¦ process. But Stacy doesn't have any reason to hide this from Mark. As far as she knows, Mark's okay with you being there.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My bet is she mentions me to Mark as little as possible, 'cause she thinks that he thinks that she still has feelings for me. And you know why she thinks that?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Because she still has feelings for you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you're right, she did tell him, and I don't get through the door tonight. But if I'm rightâ€¦

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: So how long do we stay here?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 'Til something happens.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: He's not going to come out with us right here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We are downwind, and he seems to have hearing loss.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: He's not blind.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Steve McQueen does not run from danger. Antibiotics on the other handâ€¦

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: He ate around the pill? Smart!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Admit it, you like him.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: He's alrightâ€¦ for a rat.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You wanna now how cool he is? His urine showed traces of hydrogen cyanide, formaldehyde, lead. He's a smoker. Your husband's been lighting up; which is particularly stupid, it could cause his AIP toâ€¦

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Okay, I blow my smoke into the vents so Mark doesn't know.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I always knew.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Bluffing!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You started two weeks after my surgery. Menthols, then lights after a month.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Why didn't you say anything?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 'Cause it helped me monitor your misery level. One trip outside was a good day, upwards of six you were in hell.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: You could have asked me how I was!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I already knew. Sorry you were miserable.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Sorry I caused you so much pain.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Glad you changed your mind about that drink.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Come on in.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You should get changed, there's this new place on campus that looksâ€¦ Are you high?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Uh huh.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I thought you disposed of the drugs.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Not all of it.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Uhh, slow downâ€¦ your pupils are dilated! Youâ€™re notâ€¦

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Come on Chase; don't turn into a good guy on me now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're lateâ€¦ and hung over. Or maybe not.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Why do you have a rat?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Jealous?

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Out of my room!

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: Don't you dare put this on me!

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: I'm not going to grovel, dad!

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: That's not what I'm asking for.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Like hell it isn't! You said you didn't call!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't mind me. Just here for the show.

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: Yeah well, there's not going to be any.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What happened to the big apology? Yesterday he was all â€˜Daddy, I'm so sowwy.â€™

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: This is none of your business.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You should have thought of that before you stalked me. Now I'm interested. So what's he got to apologize for? You're the one who tossed him out.

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: Now why would I do that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't know. 'Cause it's tough to brag to your hunting buddies that your son knows all the words of The Wiz.

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: That's a lie!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 42nd Street? Much easier to just get drunk and beat him. Explains his hating you; also your cirrhosis. Also why the more I talk, the more you sweat. What it doesn't explain, is why he's gotta apologize to you. Residual guilt for sharing your special toy with other boys?

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Just leave it alone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just want to leave the bigot with some peace of mind after you're gone?

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: Look, this has got nothing, and I mean nothing to do with him being gay! Now Kal brought this on himself, with what he did to his mother!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He steal her signature look?

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: No. No, he killed her.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Kalvin lied!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, that certainly is shocking.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Mom's kidneys were failing, she needed a transplant, they tested Kalvin, he was a match. He was also positive for HIV, mom never found a qualified donor, she dies.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Tragic tale. Undercut slightly by the rapid fire delivery and constant movement. Too much coffee this morning?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He didn't kill her. Our bodies aren't donor farms for our parents.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's not 1980. We know how HIV is transmitted! If Kalvin got HIV through unprotected sex, dad has every right to be pissed!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: So you always use a condom?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Uhh... yeah!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Brother's on the down-low got to

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Huh, not ready for any Foreman Juniors yet.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Working girls are sticklers. You're not going to poll Chase?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm not an idiot.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Obviously not. Who doesn't sleep with a drugged out colleague when they have a chance?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Where's Wilson?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We got the result for the Kveim test.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Soâ€¦ I have cancer?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: In all likelihood, yeah. Non-Hodgkins Lymphoma.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: And I amâ€¦ dying?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: We need to biopsy the tumor. It's near your aorta soâ€¦ getting that sample carries serious risks.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Is my dad still here?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He hasn't been in?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Ativan. Itâ€™ll help settle you down.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Why are you so calm?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Not coming off meth helps. Last night probably shouldn't happen again.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Do you think I want it to?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: When two people have had sex, unless it sucks, if they can do it again, they're gonna do it again. And that's when things get complicated. And it didn't suck.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So now you've got to drum up another excuse to be around the love of your life. Could hit another patient.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nyah, don't like to repeat myself. People will say I'm formulaic.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well that rules out letting the rat go so you can catch him again.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I can't do that, Steve needs two weeks antibiotics and a smoke-free environment. Cigarettes aggravated his infection.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: The rat is actually sick? That thing could infect the entire hospital!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Steve's infection is not contagious to humans. I'm an idiot. How did I miss mycoplasmosis? Was that the kid's father?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah. Remember the Black Death? Started with rats

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What's he doing in the hallway? His kid getting his biopsy already?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He just won't go in the room. Who knows what else he has - parasites? Bacterial infection?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Kid doesn't have parasites.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Not the kid, the rat!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Was he still sweating?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Rats only sweat through their tails.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not the rat, the dad! Where are they from?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Errâ€¦ Montana. What's going on?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You were right, it's a parasite. Cancel the biopsy. Itâ€™ll kill him. Hey daddy, come with me!

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: Yeah, uhhâ€¦ I'm not going in there.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your son asked to talk to you.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Why is he here?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He wanted to talk to you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did you two use to hunt together? Foxes. Did you kill foxes?

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: Itâ€™s Montana.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Those masses in your chest are not tumors. They're parasitic cysts from a bug called echinococcus. Touch a dead fox, they jump aboard, they can hunker down for decades -- growing, spawning, shopping, putting on plays.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: I've been tested for parasites.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, it's cancer. You happy? The cysts isolate the parasites, keeping them from showing up in stool samples, even in blood tests, cardiac--

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: All right, you don't need me for this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But you've got the same things in your liver.

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: I have cirrhosis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Liver cysts have identical symptoms with one addition, fever. Now liver cysts we can test for. Your diagnosis could confirm Kalvin's. So, option A, we draw some blood--

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: No, look, you're not touching me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You see, this is why I need you here. I want you to tell your son that you won't take a simple painless blood test to save his life.

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: You errâ€¦ never expressed a shred of regret for what happened to your mother.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Geez, dadâ€¦

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: If you'd have worn a damn rubber, you'd have been fine; could have saved her life. You wouldn't be lying here!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah, I get it! You're really mad at him for killing himself and for destroying everything you love. I don't have time for this, are you going to apologize?

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: I'm living my life the way I want.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Are you going to give me some blood?

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: Look, if he doesn't give a damn then neither do I!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay. Option B. Why did your wife kill herself? Did she hate you?

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: She was a diabetic!

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: You know you don't know a thing about my Suzanne.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Either Suzanne wanted to die, or she was both fat AND stupid. Used a Twinkie instead of a gun. And girls with big appetites, well they just can't get enough - of anything!

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Shut up!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Probably nibbled on every devil dog in the county!

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: SHUT UP!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just in case I'm not making myself clear, I don't mean the delicious snackâ€¦

utterance.speaker: Dad
utterance.content: You son of a bitch! Yeah? Come on!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thank you, means I can do this We're going to need some epi in here, stat!

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: Are you out of your mind?!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You said you didn't care. Notice how you can't breathe? Now either that's the cane, or I just ruptured one of those liver cysts we were chatting about and you've gone into anaphylactic shock, exactly the same as your son did when he accidentally tripped against my friend's car. I'm just SO excited to find out which! I'm gonna schedule surgery.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Two successful surgeries, two lives saved. I'm over my quota. Can I have next week off?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Two family members assaulted.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It was self defense.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You baited him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're right. I was asking for it. The low-cut blouse, the 'Do-Me' pumps.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You flooded his gut with a parasite, he could sue. Go see Stacy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: That's it? Okay? No name-calling? No squawking? No rending of garments?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I like this T-shirt.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You lied to me.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: If this is about my momâ€¦

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: This is about your lonely, miserable life.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: I'm not miserable. And as long as there's a gay bar around, I'm never lonely.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You haven't had a single visitor except for your dad. Drugs are great, HIV freed you, your dad hates you, you're so happy. Everything's a lie! You blame yourself for your mom's death. You're not trying to have fun, you're trying to self-destruct. You wanna kill yourself? Fine, but stop recruiting!

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Heard you hit another patient.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, sure. Why not? He hit me first.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Cuddy didn't mention that. Let me see.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm the doctor.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: My concern is purely legal. Looks okay, does it hurt?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: A little.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: You need some ice.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There's no way that Mark doesn't know; about the smoking.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: He would have said something.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Then he hasn't been near you in months.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: We're fine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can't be easy.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Stop squirming.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why would you lie about this?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: I'm not lying.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't care if you're sleeping with him or not, but you're not, soâ€¦

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: I am.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're lying.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: You know when I have sex? You can smell that on me too? The only people who know about what's going on between me and Mark are me and Mark.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I just know you.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: And I know you. You're confident, arrogant, but you're never certain unless there's a reason to be certain. One other person knew, I told you I was seeing Dr Harper. You can easily get into her office, you read my file. You read my file? The dishes, the concern, the, oh, acting like a human being? You haveâ€¦ This whole time you've been manipulating me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You knew I had an angle the moment I poured soap onto a scrub brush. You could have thrown me out, or ignored me, or found another exterminator. You didn't even tell Mark that I kept coming by. You LET this happen because you wanna be with me.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: I don't anymore. Get out.

utterance.speaker: Kalvin
utterance.content: I'm sorry.
